articles.title: Could robotics and timber tackle Britain's housing challenges?
articles.summary: Gigantic robot arms controlled by artificial intelligence glide around a vast factory in Oxfordshire, England, making building frames from timber, one of the world's oldest construction materials.
articles.translated_title: Could robotics and timber tackle Britain's housing challenges?
articles.translated_summary: Gigantic robot arms controlled by artificial intelligence glide around a vast factory in Oxfordshire, England, making building frames from timber, one of the world's oldest construction materials.

articles.title: DeepSeek's launch of new AI model delayed by Huawei chip issues, FT reports
articles.summary: Chinese artificial intelligence company DeepSeek has delayed the release of its new model after failing to train it using Huawei's chips, highlighting the limits of Beijing's push to replace U.S. technology, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.
articles.translated_title: DeepSeek's launch of new AI model delayed by Huawei chip issues, FT reports
articles.translated_summary: Chinese artificial intelligence company DeepSeek has delayed the release of its new model after failing to train it using Huawei's chips, highlighting the limits of Beijing's push to replace U.S. technology, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.

articles.title: Illinois becomes third state to restrict use of AI in mental health industry as experts warn about 'AI psychosis'
articles.summary: Illinois passed a bill banning therapists from employing artificial intelligence chatbots for assistance with mental health therapy as experts countrywide warn against people's ever-growing reliance on the machines.
articles.translated_title: Illinois becomes third state to restrict use of AI in mental health industry as experts warn about 'AI psychosis'
articles.translated_summary: Illinois passed a bill banning therapists from employing artificial intelligence chatbots for assistance with mental health therapy as experts countrywide warn against people's ever-growing reliance on the machines.

articles.title: Google to Spend $9 Billion in Oklahoma to Expand AI, Cloud Infrastructure
articles.summary: Alphabet's Google said it will spend an additional $9 billion in Oklahoma over the next two years to expand cloud and artificial intelligence infrastructure.
articles.translated_title: Google to Spend $9 Billion in Oklahoma to Expand AI, Cloud Infrastructure
articles.translated_summary: Alphabet's Google said it will spend an additional $9 billion in Oklahoma over the next two years to expand cloud and artificial intelligence infrastructure.

articles.title: Apple's AI Comeback Plans Include Robots, Lifelike Siri
articles.summary: Apple Inc. is plotting its artificial intelligence comeback with an ambitious slate of new devices, including robots, a lifelike version of Siri, a smart speaker with a display and home-security cameras. Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman speaks with Romaine Bostick and Matt Miller on ‚ÄúThe Close‚Äù about Apple‚Äôs next inventions. (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: AI 'godfather' Geoffrey Hinton warns machines may outthink humans in years
articles.summary: Geoff Hinton warns artificial intelligence could surpass humans within years, not decades, and recommends a focus on creating maternal instincts in machines.
articles.translated_title: AI 'godfather' Geoffrey Hinton warns machines may outthink humans in years

articles.title: Trump‚Äôs AI chip deal sparks legal questions and national security concerns
articles.summary: President Trump stunned many in the tech world after announcing a controversial deal with chipmakers Nvidia and AMD, allowing them to sell advanced artificial intelligence chips to China in exchange for giving the U.S. government a 15% cut of their revenue. Amna Nawaz discussed the legality of this deal and its implications with Scott Kennedy of the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

articles.title: Illinois law bans AI use to provide mental health advice
articles.summary: Illinois recently passed a law that prohibits the use of artificial intelligence for mental health interactions or decisions.

articles.title: AI demand expected to boost electronics giant Foxconn's second-quarter profit
articles.summary: Taiwan's Foxconn , the world's largest contract electronics maker, is expected to report on Thursday that second-quarter profit rose 11% on continued strong demand for artificial intelligence servers.
